title.en: Medical History of the Internal Medicine Patient

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

course_main_structural_unit.address:
L. Puusepa 8
50406 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: During the course students learn the basic terminology of clinical medicine, obtain the skills for interviewing the patients, obtain skills to present and write down the results of the medical interview.
description.et: Kursuse raames õpitakse tundma kliinilise meditsiini põhiterminoloogiat, omandatakse oskused haige küsitlemiseks, omandatakse oskus kanda ette ning vormistada kirjalikult haige anamnees.

objectives.en: To obtain the basic skills of the medical interviewing, the structure of the interview (anamnesis) and documenting. To know the main documentation used in the hospital (electronic health record, informed consent form).
objectives.et: Omandada haige küsitluse esmased oskused, anamneesi kogumise ja dokumenteerimise struktuur.

objectives.en: To understand the different ways how the patients arrive to the hospital (planned, emergent cases, referred patients, patients brought by the ambulances) and respective differences in collecting the anamneesis of these patient groups.
objectives.et: Tutvuda haiglas kasutatava peamise dokumentatsiooniga (elektrooniline haiguslugu, informeeritud nõusolek). Mõista patsientide haiglasse saabumise erinevaid viise (plaanilised, erakorralised, suunamiskirjaga saabunud, kiirabiga toodud patsiendid) ja vastavaid anamneesi kogumise erisusi.

objectives.en: To know the possible ethical considerations while communicating to patients, the importance of the confidentiality requirements.
objectives.et: Teada võimalikke eetilisi probleeme patsiendiga suhtlemisel, konfidentsiaalsusnõude tähtsust.

learning_outcomes.en: The students who have successfully passed the course
1) are able to interview the patients, possess the methodology of colleeting a complete medical history
learning_outcomes.et: 1) oskavad haiget küsitleda, valdavad täieliku anamneesi kogumise metoodikat

learning_outcomes.en: 2) know the basic terminology of clinical medicine
3) are able to present and write down the medical history
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskavad kanda ette ning vormistada kirjalikult haige anamneesi

learning_outcomes.en: 4) know the structure of patient medical record (hospital and out-patient) and how to fulfill these documents
learning_outcomes.et: 4) tunnevad patsiendi haigusloo ülesehitust ning täitmise nõudeid

learning_outcomes.en: 9) orientate in the theoretical and ethical principles of the doctor-patient relationship
learning_outcomes.et: 5) orienteeruvad arsti-haige suhte teoreetilistes alustes ja eetilistes printsiipides

grade_preconditions.et: Participation at all practical sessions is mandatory

grade_evaluation.et: Participation at all practical sessions is mandatory

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with the professor before the end of the semester

resources.mandatory_materials:
M. Lember, K. Saks, K. Põlluste, R. Kermes, P. Saadla, K. Kärberg, M. Pauklin, J. Karindi, L. Kiivikas, K. Veermäe, K. Väljataga. L. Hein, L. Kits Propaedeutics of Internal Medicine Synopsis 2023
Mustajoki P, Saha H, Sane T. Haige uurimine. Medicina 2005
resources.recommended_materials: Hutchinson`s clinical methods. Ed by M.Swash. WB Saunders.

description.et: 1. Work organization at the Internal Medicine Clinic. different ways how the patients arrive to the hospital (planned, emergent cases, referred patients, patients brought by the ambulances)  The main documents at the hospital. Informed consent. Ethical considerations while communicating to patients. Medical history. Demonstration by the lecturer about taking a medical history
2. Independent medical history taking by students. Documenting the medical history.
3. Presentation of medical histories. Introduction of EHL on the selected patient
